text: Thank you :) I don't think you'd need to become a qualified secondary school teacher if you only want to lecture. I think you'd be best off if you did your bachelor's degree, then your master's and then right into your PhD if possible (while you're getting your doctorate they often let you teach an undergraduate module so you get a feel for things). Even if you didn't go for the PhD, you can still become a professor and teach full modules etc. One thing I would recommend - if you don't already do it - is getting some tutoring experience under your belt. Primary/ks3/gcse would all be good on your CV later, as well as your uni application. Also a nice little job to have in terms of having some spare money throughout uni where you can work hours that suit you
On that note, are there any unis you definitely want to apply to?
